Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Misunderstand \Mis*un`der*stand"\ (m[i^]s*[u^]n`d[~e]r*st[a^]nd"), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Misunderstood} (m[i^]s*[u^]n`d[~e]r*st[oo^]d"); p. pr. & vb. n. {Misunderstanding}.] To misconceive; to mistake; to miscomprehend; to take in a wrong sense. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
ill-treated \ill-treated\ adj. physically abused. [Narrower terms: {assaulted, molested, raped ; {battered, beaten ; {misunderstood ]
Syn: abused, maltreated, mistreated. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
mistreated \mistreated\ adj. physically abused. [Narrower terms: {assaulted, molested, raped}; {battered, beaten}; {misunderstood ]
Syn: abused, ill-treated, maltreated. [WordNet 1.5]
misunderstood adj 1: wrongly understood; "a misunderstood criticism"; "a misunderstood question" 2: not given sympathetic understanding; "a sorely misunderstood child"

misunderstand v : interpret in the wrong way; "Don't misinterpret my comments as criticism"; "She misconstrued my remarks" [syn: {misconstrue}, {misinterpret}, {misconceive}, {misapprehend}, {be amiss}] [also: {misunderstood}]
